itemBody.p: In a capitalist system, do you believe government regulations are helpful or harmful?

modalFeedback.p: You agree with democratic socialists. They believe that as long as private corporations exist — and they freely acknowledge that that will be the case for the foreseeable future — the government should regulate them in order to, in their view, mitigate the harms of capitalism and push companies to act in the best interests of workers and society as a whole. For example, a democratic socialist might support strengthening labor laws, raising the minimum wage, mandating parental leave, barring companies from outsourcing jobs to low-wage countries and banning environmentally harmful activities.
